options.name: Informal
options.description:
Process Objective / Outcomes:No defined and the need is not clearly recognised
Process Development:None

options.name: Aware
options.description:
Process Objective / Outcomes:Has been defined and the need is understood
Process Development:Initiated

options.name: Formulated
options.description:
Process Objective / Outcomes:Has been defined and the need is understood
Process Development:Significantly developed
Process Robustness:The process includes some aspects of the measure definition

options.name: Advanced
options.description:
Process Objective / Outcomes:Has been defined and the need is understood in detail
Process Development:Substantially complete
Process Robustness:The process incorporates most aspects of the measure definition

options.name: Robust
options.description:
Process Objective / Outcomes:Has been defined and the need is understood in detail
Process Development:Complete
Process Robustness:The process incorporates most aspects of the measure definition

parts.name: Documentation
parts.description: How well documented is our process

options.name: None
options.description:
Documentation Development:None
Documentation Testing and Verification:Unknown

options.name: Minimal
options.description:
Documentation Development:Some brief notes are available
Documentation Testing and Verification:Uncertainty of its accuracy, completeness or usefulness

options.name: Moderate
options.description:
Documentation Development:Structured but not comprehensive
Documentation Testing and Verification:Limited checking and not yet checked by the person(s) responsible / accountable

options.name: Advanced
options.description:
Documentation Development:Substantially complete
Documentation Testing and Verification:Checked, but may not yet have been checked by the person(s) responsible / accountable

options.name: Complete
options.description:
Documentation Development:Complete
Documentation Testing and Verification:Checked by the person(s) responsible / accountable

parts.name: Coverage & Frequency
parts.description: How widespread and applied are our processes

options.name: Sparse
options.description:
Geographic Area:In use in very few relevant areas(<25%)
Asset Classes / Categories:In use in very few relevant asset classes(<25%)
Service Provided:In use in very few services(<25%)
Frequency of Use:Use is uncommon and known to a few personnel

options.name: Limited
options.description:
Geographic Area:In use in few relevant areas (25 to 50%)
Asset Classes / Categories:In use in few relevant asset (25 to 50%)
Service Provided:In use in few services (25 to 50%)
Frequency of Use:Used intemittently with no systematic management and there are significant gaps in staff use

options.name: Moderate
options.description:
Geographic Area:In use in many relevant areas (50 to 75%)
Asset Classes / Categories:In use in many relevant assets (50 to 75%)
Service Provided:In use in many services (50 to 75%)
Frequency of Use:Used often and the developed process is generally adhered to by many relevant staff

options.name: Predominant
options.description:
Geographic Area:In use in most relevant areas (>75%)
Asset Classes / Categories:In use in most relevant asset classes(>75%)
Service Provided:In use in most services(>75%)
Frequency of Use:Used consistently with few deviations from the developed process by most relevant staff

options.name: Total
options.description:
Geographic Area:Can demonstrate its use in all relevant areas
Asset Classes / Categories:Can demonstrate its use in all relevant asset classes
Service Provided:Can demonstrate its use in all services
Frequency of Use:Can demonstrate that the process is used(>90% of the time) by the majority of relevant staff(>90%)

parts.name: Effectiveness
parts.description: How well do our processes deliver the desired outcomes

options.name: Rarely
options.description: Achieve Desired Outcomes:Step 1 defined outcomes not achieved

options.name: Occasionally
options.description: Achieve Desired Outcomes:Step 1 defined outcomes not achieved in few relevant areas(25% to 50%)

options.name: Often
options.description: Achieve Desired Outcomes:Step 1 defined outcomes not achieved in many relevant areas(50% to 75%)

options.name: Usually
options.description: Achieve Desired Outcomes:Step 1 defined outcomes not achieved in most relevant areas(>75%)

options.name: Always
options.description: Achieve Desired Outcomes:Can show Step 1 defined outcomes are achieved in all relevant areas

options.name: Basic
options.description:
Functional need not adequately defined.
System meets some needs but inadequate for all the participants requirements.
Scope for major improvement.

options.name: Limited
options.description:
Functional need more broadly defined.
System meets most current basic participant requirements.
Improvements needed to fully meet current basic needs.

options.name: Adequate
options.description:
Functional need fully defined.
System meets current basic needs.
Further development would allow increased use / application.

options.name: Good
options.description:
Functional need fully defined.
System meets all defined needs most of the time with only minor inadequacies.

options.name: Comprehensive
options.description: Participant is confident that the system functionality imposes no restrictions in its application.

options.name: Poor
options.description: Meets some needs but inadequate for participant requirements.

options.name: Limited
options.description: Meets most current basic needs with some improvements needed.

options.name: Adequate
options.description: Meets current basic needs. Additional capacity would allow participant to increase use of application.

options.name: Good
options.description: Meets needs most of the time with only minor inadequacies.

options.name: Comprehensive
options.description: Participant is confident that the system capacity imposes no restrictions in its application

options.name: Difficult
options.description:
Manual systems in all areas.
Verbal communication used in some instances.
Forms used are difficult to read and understand.
Systems are hard to use, known to be a cause of a large number data recording errors.
Lack of commitment by those capturing.

options.name: Limited
options.description:
Manual systems in use.
Forms used are of a basic design, hard to read and understand, but reduced potential for incorrect data entry.
No verbal data capture. Some commitment to accurate and timely capture evident.

options.name: Adequate
options.description:
Manual systems in most areas, some electronic aids.
Forms designed, but some difficulty in reading / understanding.
Commitment to accurate and timely capture widespread.

options.name: Good
options.description:
Electronic systems used in most relevant areas.
Manual systems in use elsewhere.
Forms, where necessary, well designed for most areas, providing good understanding of data requirements.
Commitment to accurate and timely capture predominates.

options.name: Effective
options.description:
Electronic systems used in all relevant areas.
Effective manual systems in use elsewhere.
Forms well designed, easily read and understood, giving minimal potential for errors.
Total commitment by all parties to accurate and timely data capture.

options.name: Poor
options.description:
Data communicated for manual input in ad hoc fashion or verbally.
Data handled, transferred or keyed several times before final entry.

options.name: Limited
options.description: Data provided in written form only but requiring entry more than once in many instances.

options.name: Adequate
options.description:
Forms (both paper and computer screens) provide for ease of entry.
Data input hampered by differences between paper forms and computer screens. Some data entered more than once.

options.name: Good
options.description:
Electronic systems providing for keyless entry except at the point of capture used in most relevant areas.
Where manual entry is used, paper forms and computer screens provide consistency of approach minimising entry errors.
No requirements for multiple entries.

options.name: Streamlined
options.description:
Electronic systems with entry at the point of capture used in all relevant areas. Well- designed manual systems in use elsewhere.
Paper and computer forms well designed, easily read and understood and single entry with minimal potential for errors.

options.name: Rare
options.description: Data not verified to any set procedure, and rarely done.

options.name: Limited
options.description: Some verification systems in place, not documented, carried out on an ad hoc basis.

options.name: Adequate
options.description: Verification procedures are such that the Participant is confident that the data is generally accurate. No quality control procedure in use.

options.name: Good
options.description: Verification procedures designed to ensure all data is verified. Procedures documented, and in use across most of the participant.

options.name: Comprehensive
options.description: All data fully verified according to the participants accuracy requirements, and to the required Quality Control standards.

options.name: Uncontrolled
options.description: Subject to change by any person with access to the system.

options.name: Limited
options.description: Change restricted to a range of approved users. No change control procedures in place.

options.name: Adequate
options.description: Change restricted to a range of approved users. Some change control procedures in place, but lacking documentation.

options.name: Good
options.description: Change restricted to a small number of approved users. Change control procedures in place, but lacking documentation.

options.name: Fully Controlled
options.description:
Change restricted to a small number of approved users.
Documented and authorised change control procedures in place.

options.name: No Backup
options.description: No data backup.

options.name: Limited
options.description:
Uncontrolled backup to cd or floppy, at user discretion.
Server files and software backed up on an irregular basis.
No copies of paper records held in secure storage.

options.name: Moderate
options.description:
Instructions issued to back up local hard drives to cd or floppy, but sometimes not implemented.
Copies of most paper records held in secure storage.
Server files and software regularly backed up.

options.name: Good
options.description:
Written procedures in place requiring regular backups of local hard drives and mostly implemented across the Agency.
Copies of all paper records held in secure storage. Server files and software regularly backed up.

options.name: Full Backup
options.description:
Procedures to back up all Agency local pc hard drives and server systems are documented and enforced.
Copies of paper records held in secure storage. Duplicate data and records held off site.

options.name: Poor
options.description:
Data, once filed is difficult to identify and recall.
Specialist assistance is always required to retrieve and transfer data.
Retrieval and delivery time can cause significant disruption to the user.

options.name: Basic
options.description:
Data is poorly indexed, difficult to locate and transfer.
Specialist assistance often required to locate and issue.
Retrieval time is satisfactory if the assistance is available

options.name: Fair
options.description:
Data is available to authorised users, sometimes through specialist personnel.
Retrieval time is not normally a problem.
There is a lack of indexing and instruction for use.

options.name: Good
options.description:
Data is available directly to authorised users, and mostly without the need for specialist assistance.
There is some indexing and instruction for use.

options.name: Excellent
options.description:
Data well indexed, instructions for location and retrieval are clear and issued to all users.
Retrieval and transfer is directly available to all authorised users.

options.name: Incompatible
options.description: Data is an unusual format not readily useable by popular spreadsheets and databases.

options.name: Limited
options.description: Data can be transferred into the required format, but this is a repetitive operation that has to be done every time the data is recalled.

options.name: Moderate
options.description: Data is generally maintained in a format that can be transferred to popular spreadsheets and databases, but the user must check before extraction that the format has been updated for current compatibility

options.name: Good
options.description: Data is normally maintained in a format that can be transferred to popular spreadsheets and databases

options.name: Fully Compatible
options.description: All data is maintained in a format that can be transferred to popular spreadsheets and databases and there is a Quality Assurance process in place to ensure compatibility.

options.name: Poor
options.description: Few interconnections with relevant systems. Very difficult to connect to other systems, requires high level system supplier technical input to do so.

options.name: Basic
options.description: Some interconnections with relevant systems. Very difficult to connect to other systems, requires well trained IT personnel to do so, working closely with the supplier.

options.name: Fair
options.description: Interconnected to many relevant systems. Connections to other systems may be made using the users manual, but IT personnel would generally refer back to the supplier for instructions.

options.name: Good
options.description: Interconnected to most relevant systems. Connections to other systems can be made by IT personnel, with reference to detailed users manual information.

options.name: Comprehensive
options.description: Interconnections to all relevant systems have been readily made by IT personnel and those interconnections which are used often are automatic.

options.name: Poor
options.description: Almost impossible to get ad hoc reports.

options.name: Basic
options.description: Ad hoc reports can be written by specialist system users, but the system itself still imposes restrictions.

options.name: Fair
options.description: Ad hoc reports can be written by specialist users using additional report writers such as Crystal.

options.name: Good
options.description: Ad hoc reports can be written by general system users using specialist additional report writers such as Crystal.

options.name: Excellent
options.description: The system has all the tools necessary for a trained user to write ad hoc reports.

options.name: Poor
options.description: Very few standard reports, and these are of little use to the Agency.

options.name: Basic
options.description:
A limited range of standard reports is provided, but not directly appropriate to the Agencys requirements.
Standard reports not generally used, ad hoc reports being required to overcome inadequacy of standard reports.

options.name: Fair
options.description:
A limited range of standard reports are provided, generally in the format required by the Agency.
Ad hoc reporting is a common requirement to overcome inadequacy of standard reports.

options.name: Good
options.description:
A range of standard reports are available which fulfill most of the Agencys requirements.
Ad hoc reporting is required on a regular basis for some users to overcome inadequacy of standard reports.

options.name: Excellent
options.description:
The Agency has researched the reporting requirements, and all users are satisfied with the scope and quality of the standard reports available.
The need for ad hoc reporting to overcome inadequacy of standard reports is minimal.

options.name: Poor
options.description: Limited documentation. Nearly useless. Hardly referred to by the users.

options.name: Basic
options.description:
Limited in scope, covering only the fundamentals.
Difficult to get answers to many questions that arise.

options.name: Fair
options.description:
Covers most areas of the system.
Fundamentals are dealt with and with some effort answers are available to most questions.

options.name: Good
options.description:
Good system coverage.
Can be relied upon to readily give answers to most questions.

options.name: Comprehensive
options.description:
Good system coverage.
Has proven to readily provide complete answers to the questions by users.

options.name: Poor
options.description: Strong antipathy towards the system, personnel avoid using it if at all possible.

options.name: Basic
options.description: Used with reluctance, and only because the tasks cannot be completed without it.

options.name: Fair
options.description: Quite usable but personnel consider that the level of training required is too great, and that if not used regularly they forget how to use it.

options.name: Good
options.description: Personnel generally satisfied with the system, but some concerns evident.

options.name: Excellent
options.description: Personnel satisfied with the system with few complaints.

options.name: Poor
options.description:
Almost nothing available.
System can only be maintained or modified by authors.

options.name: Basic
options.description:
Some documentation available, generally fairly superficial and lacking definition in key areas.
Detailed, system specific training required to maintain or to modify the system.

options.name: Fair
options.description: Documentation of basic flow charts and some code labeling. System maintainers require some system specific training.

options.name: Good
options.description: Documentation is clear and generally meets standards and the user needs. Some problems with clarity and scope. Maintenance can be carried out by most IT staff without specific training.

options.name: Comprehensive
options.description:
Documentation is complete, clear, specific, and compliant with standards for code documentation and there are no complaints.
Maintenance can be carried out by IT staff without specific training.

options.name: Poor
options.description: Routine software updates not implemented. No forecast of future needs and no action being taken to avoid obsolescence.

options.name: Basic
options.description: Some software updates identified but not implemented. Some superficial assessment of future needs, but no planning in place for maintenance or upgrade

options.name: Fair
options.description:
Assessment of future needs has been carried out in a detailed way, but is not revised on a regular basis.
System software is regularly upgraded to meet requirements. Upgrades planned but timing is undetermined and budget not identified

options.name: Good
options.description:
Assessment of future needs has been carried out in a detailed way and is revised on a regular basis.
Upgrades planned but timing is undetermined. Budget identified and provided for on a contingency basis.

options.name: Comprehensive
options.description:
Full assessment of future needs has been carried out and documented and is revised on a regular basis. The system is maintained / upgraded at the optimum time to provide the identified level of service.
Budget identified and provided for.

options.name: Poor
options.description:
Frequent down time, high level of user frustration.
Unreliable to the point where staff doubt that it can continue in its present form.

options.name: Basic
options.description:
Problems with unavailability, especially at times of peak use or during important events.
As a result data loss often occurs.

options.name: Fair
options.description:
Some problems with unavailability, especially at times of peak use or during important events.
Some data loss may occur.

options.name: Good
options.description:
Few problems with unavailability, especially at times of peak use or during important events.
Data loss is not unknown, but is so infrequent that it is not a major issue.

options.name: High
options.description: Rarely if ever unavailable when required.

options.name: None
options.description:
System never reviewed since implementation.
Agency is unaware if system continues to deliver benefits exceeding its costs

options.name: Basic
options.description:
System has been reviewed in the past but no current review.
Agency remains unsure if system continues to deliver benefits exceeding its costs.

options.name: Moderate
options.description: System has been reviewed on an ad hoc basis for meeting desired outcomes, technical obsolescence, usage and cost. Reviews do not consider these in a framework of benefits versus cost to the agency. Some improvement opportunities are implemented.

options.name: Good
options.description: System is regularly reviewed for meeting desired outcomes, technical obsolescence, usage and cost. The review considers these in a qualitative framework of benefits versus cost to the agency. Many improvement opportunities are identified and implemented.

options.name: Comprehensive
options.description: System is routinely reviewed as part of a documented business process. Review considers required outcomes, technical obsolescence, usage and cost. The review considers these in a quantitative framework of benefits versus cost to the agency. All improvement opportunities are identified and implemented.
